thread.title: Kay Burgess
thread.title_full: Trewarne Fine Jewellery reviewed by Kay Burgess

author: Kay Burgess
title: Kay Burgess
text: The staff were so kind to me when I told them about the experience my daughter in NZ had when she took her late grandmother's pearl necklace into a jeweller to see if they could repair the clasp that was broken so she could wear them at her wedding. We knew the du Barry pearls that had belonged to my mother in law where not expensive but they had great sentimental value especially to my daughter as she had a very close bond with her grandmother. The jewellers in NZ said they weren't valuable and couldn't help her. She was so upset. I told my daughter that on my next visit back to NZ I would get the pearl necklace from her and take it back to Melbourne. I got the opposite response from Trewarne jewellers, they listened to my story and then provided a solution for me, they were so sympathetic. They went to a lot of trouble looking for a clasp that would suit the pearl necklace. The staff restrung the necklace as the threads were so worn on them and cleaned them. The necklace looks so lovely now and I know my daughter is going to be so happy on her wedding day wearing her Gran's pearls. I can't recommend these jewellers enough for the wonderful service they gave me.
